text: There isn’t a public API documented for this endpoint
This is awesome, thank you Matt

Hey there, I’m looking at the Workflows API — I see you can define the “actions” parameter (including support for Branching logic) when using the *create workflow* API request: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflows/v3/create_workflow>

However, when you *Get a Workflow* request, it doesn’t seem to output the Actions, just some metadata: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/workflows/v3/get_workflow>

I was hoping to be able to export an existing workflow, and use find/replace to update some property references, then create a version of the original that used the updated properties — not sure if this is possible…?  Having to do this for a series of related workflows (and also want to keep the originals as well), so trying to save time over cloning each workflow and manually updating each property reference through the UI.
*Does anyone know if it’s possible to export the “Actions” JSON for an existing workflow? ^*

Hey <@UDQ77R8AC> When I do a GET to the Get workflow endpoint, I do see a actions array in the returned JSON. Can you direct message me a link ot the workflow where you aren’t seeing this actions array?
yeah give me one sec.  I’m wondering if there is a query parameter that defines whether to include this or not?
No, it should be there by default (it was for me at any rate)
